page.title: 07Employment in Stirling
page.content: The people who are employed in Stirling mainly give a service to the public or work in offices. Of those who are employed outside Stirling most have chosen to live in Stirling because it is ideally situated between two of the main industrial cities, Glasgow and Edinburgh. There are also a few new development schemes on the outskirts of Stirling which will supply jobs for the future if given sufficient funding. There have been many redundancies due to the closures of Fine Fare, Halfords, Players Cigarette Factory, Carpet Factories and six other factories. Their closures has given way to smaller enterprises. There are only two production factories left in Stirling- the Rubber Factory and the Sausage Factory.
